text: Hand, Foot and Mouth Disease (HFMD) is a human disease which is caused by a strain of Coxsackie A virus. Signs and symptoms include: *Fever *Headache *Vomiting *Fatigue *Aches and pains (malaise) *Earache *Sore throat *Painful mouth sores *Body rash *Sores with blisters on hand *Red rash on hands (palamar erythema) *Mouth lesions *Loss of appetite *Diarrhea HFMD is very common, especially in babies and young children. It is easily spread from person to person, so it often happens in a nursery or kindergarten. Outbreaks occur every few years in different parts of the world including Asian countries. Only a small number of people get sick enough to go to a hospital. There is also no specific treatment for HFMD. It goes away on its own in about 7 to 10 days. == Asia == Over the last decade, many outbreaks of HFMD have been reported in countries of the Western Pacific Region. Recently, countries with large increases in the number of reported cases in Asia have included China, Japan, Hong Kong (China), Republic of Korea, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand and Viet Nam. In Viet Nam, HFMD circulates year-round in most provinces with two associated peaks, from March to May and from September to December. ==References== Category:Diseases caused by viruses
title: Hand, foot, and mouth disease
